• CHAPTER I - General provisions
    • Subject-matter and objectives - (Article 1)
    • Material scope - (Article 2)
    • Territorial scope - (Article 3)
    • Definitions - (Article 4)
  • CHAPTER II - Principles
    • Principles relating to processing of personal data - (Article 5)
    • Lawfulness of processing - (Article 6)
    • Conditions for consent - (Article 7)
    • Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services - (Article 8)
    • Processing of special categories of personal data - (Article 9)
    • Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences - (Article 10)
    • Processing which does not require identification - (Article 11)
  • CHAPTER III - Rights of the data subject
    • Section 1 - Transparency and modalities
      • Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject - (Article 12)
    • Section 2 - Information and access to personal data
      • Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject - (Article 13)
      • Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject - (Article 14)
      • Right of access by the data subject - (Article 15)
    • Section 3 - Rectification and erasure
      • Right to rectification - (Article 16)
      • Right to erasure (‘right to be forgotten’) - (Article 17)
      • Right to restriction of processing - (Article 18)
      • Notification obligation regarding rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing - (Article 19)
      • Right to data portability - (Article 20)
    • Section 4 - Right to object and automated individual decision-making
      • Right to object - (Article 21)
      • Automated individual decision-making, including profiling - (Article 22)
    • Section 5 - Restrictions
      • Restrictions - (Article 23)
  • CHAPTER IV - Controller and processor
    • Section 1 - General obligations
      • Responsibility of the controller - (Article 24)
      • Data protection by design and by default - (Article 25)
      • Joint controllers - (Article 26)
      • Representatives of controllers or processors not established in the Union - (Article 27)
      • Processor - (Article 28)
      • Processing under the authority of the controller or processor - (Article 29)
      • Records of processing activities - (Article 30)
      • Cooperation with the supervisory authority - (Article 31)
    • Section 2 - Security of personal data
      • Security of processing - (Article 32)
      • Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority - (Article 33)
      • Communication of a personal data breach to the data subject - (Article 34)
    • Section 3 - Data protection impact assessment and prior consultation
      • Data protection impact assessment - (Article 35)
      • Prior consultation - (Article 36)
    • Section 4 - Data protection officer
      • Designation of the data protection officer - (Article 37)
      • Position of the data protection officer - (Article 38)
      • Tasks of the data protection officer - (Article 39)
    • Section 5 - Codes of conduct and certification
      • Codes of conduct - (Article 40)
      • Monitoring of approved codes of conduct - (Article 41)
      • Certification - (Article 42)
      • Certification bodies - (Article 43)
  • CHAPTER V - Transfers of personal data to third countries or international organisations
    • General principle for transfers - (Article 44)
    • Transfers on the basis of an adequacy decision - (Article 45)
    • Transfers subject to appropriate safeguards - (Article 46)
    • Binding corporate rules - (Article 47)
    • Transfers or disclosures not authorised by Union law - (Article 48)
    • Derogations for specific situations - (Article 49)
    • International cooperation for the protection of personal data - (Article 50)
  • CHAPTER VI - Independent supervisory authorities
    • Section 1 - Independent status
      • Supervisory authority - (Article 51)
      • Independence - (Article 52)
      • General conditions for the members of the supervisory authority - (Article 53)
      • Rules on the establishment of the supervisory authority - (Article 54)
    • Section 2 - Competence, tasks and powers
      • Competence - (Article 55)
      • Competence of the lead supervisory authority - (Article 56)
      • Tasks - (Article 57)
      • Powers - (Article 58)
      • Activity reports - (Article 59)
  • CHAPTER VII - Cooperation and consistency
    • Section 1 - Cooperation
      • Cooperation between the lead supervisory authority and the other supervisory authorities concerned - (Article 60)
      • Mutual assistance - (Article 61)
      • Joint operations of supervisory authorities - (Article 62)
    • Section 2 - Consistency
      • Consistency mechanism - (Article 63)
      • Opinion of the Board - (Article 64)
      • Dispute resolution by the Board - (Article 65)
      • Urgency procedure - (Article 66)
      • Exchange of information - (Article 67)
    • Section 3 - European data protection board
      • European Data Protection Board - (Article 68)
      • Independence - (Article 69)
      • Tasks of the Board - (Article 70)
      • Reports - (Article 71)
      • Procedure - (Article 72)
      • Chair - (Article 73)
      • Tasks of the Chair - (Article 74)
      • Secretariat - (Article 75)
      • Confidentiality - (Article 76)
  • CHAPTER VIII - Remedies, liability and penalties
    • Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority - (Article 77)
    • Right to an effective judicial remedy against a supervisory authority - (Article 78)
    • Right to an effective judicial remedy against a controller or processor - (Article 79)
    • Representation of data subjects - (Article 80)
    • Suspension of proceedings - (Article 81)
    • Right to compensation and liability - (Article 82)
    • General conditions for imposing administrative fines - (Article 83)
    • Penalties - (Article 84)
  • CHAPTER IX - Provisions relating to specific processing situations
    • Processing and freedom of expression and information - (Article 85)
    • Processing and public access to official documents - (Article 86)
    • Processing of the national identification number - (Article 87)
    • Processing in the context of employment - (Article 88)
    • Safeguards and derogations relating to processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes - (Article 89)
    • Obligations of secrecy - (Article 90)
    • Existing data protection rules of churches and religious associations - (Article 91)
  • CHAPTER X - Delegated acts and implementing acts
    • Exercise of the delegation - (Article 92)
    • Committee procedure - (Article 93)
  • CHAPTER XI - Final provisions
    • Repeal of Directive 95/46/EC - (Article 94)
    • Relationship with Directive 2002/58/EC - (Article 95)
    • Relationship with previously concluded Agreements - (Article 96)
    • Commission reports - (Article 97)
    • Review of other Union legal acts on data protection - (Article 98)
    • Entry into force and application - (Article 99)
